title: How to Make Barbecue Flank Steak

steps.headline: Roll the steak.
steps.description: The steak may already be rolled, but if is isn't, you have to do it by yourself. Pound steak if necessary. Then tightly roll the steak, and tie it so it doesn't fall apart.

steps.headline: Rub the steak all over with half the salt, pepper, and spices.
steps.description: Let rest while you prepare the sauce.

steps.headline: To make barbecue sauce, combine ketchup, sugar, liquid smoke, and remaining seasonings.
Place the rolled steak into a 9x9 baking dish.
steps.description: Combine 1/4 cup barbecue sauce and stock; pour this over meat.

steps.headline: Cover with aluminum foil and bake in a preheated 300 degree F (150 C)oven for about 1-2.5 hours depending on size of steak.
Remove steak from oven, slice with a carving knife and arrange on a serving platter while you make the sauce.
Melt butter in a skillet until it foams.
steps.description: Then, add flour and cook, stirring frequently, until mixture is brown. Pour in the remaining barbecue sauce and half of the cooking liquid. Cook until about a quarter is evaporated. Pour over steak.

text: Roll the steak. The steak may already be rolled, but if is isn't, you have to do it by yourself. Pound steak if necessary. Then tightly roll the steak, and tie it so it doesn't fall apart. Rub the steak all over with half the salt, pepper, and spices. Let rest while you prepare the sauce. To make barbecue sauce, combine ketchup, sugar, liquid smoke, and remaining seasonings.  Place the rolled steak into a 9x9 baking dish. Combine 1/4 cup barbecue sauce and stock; pour this over meat. Cover with aluminum foil and bake in a preheated 300 degree F (150 C)oven for about 1-2.5 hours depending on size of steak.  Remove steak from oven, slice with a carving knife and arrange on a serving platter while you make the sauce.  Melt butter in a skillet until it foams. Then, add flour and cook, stirring frequently, until mixture is brown. Pour in the remaining barbecue sauce and half of the cooking liquid. Cook until about a quarter is evaporated. Pour over steak.
